relation: Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
There are ghosts in Cole Hall, by the football field, and in Memorial Hall. The one in Memorial can be very loud and unwelcoming if you're there late at night by yourself.

Ok. Not the best, but edible. You're not there for 5-star meals, anyway.
RAs enforce the rules, but are reasonable as well. Don't be a jerk and you won't bring trouble upon yourself.
Professors will try their best to help you understand material and pass a class- all you have to do is ask for help.
Join Comitatus, the medieval swordsmanship group on campus! It's a great group of people and they do all sorts of cool stuff!

Bridgewater is a fun, close-knit community focused on both academics and personal growth. Getting involved is essential, and there are tons of great student-run clubs and organizations in which to do so. Professors are friendly and try to develop close friendships with their students, which can be a great help and positive experience in your time at BC.
